qas.question: Who starred in 'Lincoln' as Abraham Lincoln?

answers.text: Team of Rivals: The Political Genius of Abraham Lincoln

qas.question: What part of Lincoln's life did the film cover?
Who played Mary Todd Lincoln in 'Lincoln'?
In what year did Team of Rivals: The Political Genius of Abraham Lincoln get released?
How many times has Spielberg been nominated for Best Director?
How many times has Daniel Day-Lewis been nominated for Best Actor?
In what year did Doris Kearns Goodwin release her first book?
What movie has covered the start of Lincoln's presidency?

context: Spielberg next directed the historical drama film <b9_0>Lincoln<b9_0/>, starring <a0_0>Daniel Day-Lewis<a0_0/> as United States President Abraham Lincoln and <a4_0>Sally Field<a4_0/> as Mary Todd Lincoln. Based on Doris Kearns Goodwin's bestseller <a1_0>Team of Rivals: The Political Genius of Abraham Lincoln<a1_0/>, the film covered <a2_0>the final four months<a2_0/> of Lincoln's life. Written by Tony Kushner, the film was shot in <a3_0>Richmond, Virginia<a3_0/>, in late <b5_0><b8_0>2011<b8_0/><b5_0/>, and was released in the United States by Disney in November 2012. The film's international distribution was handled by 20th Century Fox. Upon release, Lincoln received widespread critical acclaim, and was nominated for <b6_0><b7_0>twelve<b7_0/><b6_0/> Academy Awards (the most of any film that year) including Best Picture and Best Director for Spielberg. It won the award for Best Production Design and Day-Lewis won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his portrayal of Lincoln, becoming the first three time winner in that category as well as the first to win for a performance directed by Spielberg.
